form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES
form.official-title: To impose criminal penalties for camping on public property in the District of Columbia.

section.header: Camping on public property in the District of Columbia

subsection.text: In this section, the term camp means to use any material to set up, maintain, or establish a temporary place of abode.
It shall be unlawful in the District of Columbia to camp on public property.
Any person who violates subsection (b) shall be fined not more than $500, imprisoned for not more than 30 days, or both.
